page.title: 11Eating-out in Turvey
page.content: Many people go to Turvey to spend an evening in one of it's pubs or eating places. The Laws is a hotel with 6 bedrooms which has been run by the present proprietor for 10 years. They employ 30 local people as part-time staff, a Chef, Assistant Chef and Manager. It's restaurant can cater for up to 60 people on a busy night and it's Grill Room up to 40 people. The Menu includes: Stilton Soup - Â£1.95, Rack of Lamb with herbs - Â£7.95, Homemade Deserts - Â£1.95, Cheese and Biscuits - Â£1.95 and Coffee with Cream - Â£0.95. The Granary, provides food prepared in traditional English country flavour. The Three Cranes, a pub with The Hunting Lodge restaurant provides live music on certain nights and Bridge classes on Sundays.
